CatDescriptText: Mr. Jack Robinson, school teacher, Beaver, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 24, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that President Eisenhower should invoke the Taft-Hartley Act in steel strike?" answer reads: "As much as I hate to say it, the use of the Taft-Hartley law seems to be the only alternative for the President, because it seems that union and management cannot bargain in good faith. But I would hate to see Government intervention, because, as things stand now, there already is too much intervention from Washington."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Jack Robinson wearing, paisley necktie, dark striped suit jacket, and light colored overcoat, standing with hands on hips in front of Beck Shoes, Fifth Avenue, Downtown
